message.content: any quick ideas to get my headset to work? lsusb for info

content.text: I'll help you troubleshoot your headset. Let me first check what USB devices are connected to see if your headset is detected.

input.description: List USB devices to identify headset

content.content:
Bus 001 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0002 Linux Foundation 2.0 root hub
Bus 001 Device 002: ID 346d:5678 USB Disk 2.0
Bus 001 Device 003: ID 046d:c33c Logitech, Inc. G512 RGB MECHANICAL GAMING KEYBOARD
Bus 001 Device 004: ID 1532:0084 Razer USA, Ltd RZ01-0321 Gaming Mouse [DeathAdder V2]
Bus 001 Device 005: ID 0ecb:206c JBL JBL Quantum350 Headset
Bus 002 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0003 Linux Foundation 3.0 root hub
Bus 003 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0002 Linux Foundation 2.0 root hub
Bus 003 Device 002: ID 04e8:6864 Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd GT-I9070 (network tethering, USB debugging enabled)
Bus 004 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0003 Linux Foundation 3.0 root hub

content.text: I can see your JBL Quantum350 Headset is detected. Let me check the audio system status and configuration:

input.command: pactl info | grep "Server Name" && pactl list sinks short && pactl list sources short
input.description: Check audio server and list audio devices

content.content:
Server Name: PulseAudio (on PipeWire 1.4.8)
23641	alsa_output.pci-0000_00_1f.3.iec958-ac3-surround-51	PipeWire	s32le 6ch 48000Hz	SUSPENDED
23738	alsa_output.pci-0000_01_00.1.hdmi-stereo	PipeWire	s16le 2ch 48000Hz	SUSPENDED
23641	alsa_output.pci-0000_00_1f.3.iec958-ac3-surround-51.monitor	PipeWire	s32le 6ch 48000Hz	SUSPENDED
23738	alsa_output.pci-0000_01_00.1.hdmi-stereo.monitor	PipeWire	s16le 2ch 48000Hz	SUSPENDED

content.text: Your headset isn't showing up in the audio devices. Let me check if it needs to be configured:

input.command: pactl list cards | grep -A 5 -i "jbl\|quantum\|headset" && wpctl status | grep -i "jbl\|quantum\|headset"
input.description: Search for headset in audio cards and wireplumber status

content.text: Let me check USB audio devices more specifically:

input.description: Check USB audio class info for JBL headset

content.content:
bInterfaceClass         3 Human Interface Device
      bInterfaceSubClass      0 [unknown]
      bInterfaceProtocol      0

toolUseResult.stdout:
bInterfaceClass         3 Human Interface Device
      bInterfaceSubClass      0 [unknown]
      bInterfaceProtocol      0

content.text: The headset is being recognized as an HID device only. Let's check kernel modules and try to reload the USB audio driver:

input.description: Check and load USB audio kernel module

content.text: I don't see `snd_usb_audio` loaded. Let's try to load it and then replug the headset:

input.command:
echo "Try these steps:

1. Load USB audio module:
   sudo modprobe snd_usb_audio

2. Unplug and replug your JBL headset

3. Check if it appears:
   pactl list cards short | grep -i usb
   
4. If still not working, check dmesg for errors:
   dmesg | tail -20

5. Alternative: restart audio services:
   systemctl --user restart pipewire pipewire-pulse wireplumber"
